alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Eastern Kent; Newport; Southeast Providence; Washington (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued December 08 at 2:36PM EST until December 11 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor to moderate flooding around high tide early Monday morning. Flooding less than one foot deep, but perhaps 1 to 2 feet deep in some locations on the upper end of Narragansett Bay including Providence. * WHERE...Communities along the shore of Narragansett Bay in Rhode Island. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Vulnerable shore roads may be closed around high tide. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. && Note: These forecasts do not yet include Monday morning`s high tide Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Narragansett Bay at Fox Point MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 9.0 ft, Major 10.5 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 2.3 ft, Moderate 4.3 ft, Major 5.8 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 08/04 AM 4.2/ 4.7 -0.6/-0.1 0.4/ 0.9 1 None 08/04 PM 3.4/ 3.9 -1.4/-0.9 0.2/ 0.7 1 None 09/05 AM 4.0/ 4.5 -0.7/-0.2 0.0/ 0.5 1 None 09/05 PM 3.7/ 4.2 -1.0/-0.5 0.4/ 0.9 1 None 10/06 AM 4.7/ 5.2 0.1/ 0.6 0.4/ 0.9 1 None 10/06 PM 4.2/ 4.7 -0.5/ 0.0 0.7/ 1.1 3-4 None Narragansett Bay at Conimicut Point MLLW Categories - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
